TopicTitle: ANyone skilled at reading crash logs?

Articles.Content:
This has happened twice so far but the second time it happened it generated a crash log.  The first time I got Krakened and it was pretty funny actually.

But I am testing craft for HatBat's series and am wondering what the main culprit is, because if it keeps doing this...

Here's the crash log https://app.box.com/s/k9g8wzrhux6zzny81u8jrq4vhtm0285x

Oh yeah, only mod in active use on the planes I was testing is BDArmory.

Judging by the huge amount of mods that you have and errors stemming from KerbPaint and BDA i would suggest to test at least without these two for a start. There is an updated version of KerbPaint from @linuxgurugamer but it seems that BDA is not updated for KSP 1.2 yet.

Offtopic: what's up with the KAX parts? 

KAX_medCockpit.cfg
medCockpit.mu
medCockpit_txr.dds

They are normally placed directly under the parent GameData folder?

Edited February 13, 2017 by Phineas Freak
Forgot a "not"...

1 hour ago, Phineas Freak said:

Judging by the huge amount of mods that you have and errors stemming from KerbPaint and BDA i would suggest to test at least without these two for a start. There is an updated version of KerbPaint from @linuxgurugamer but it seems that BDA is updated for KSP 1.2 yet.

Offtopic: what's up with the KAX parts? 


KAX_medCockpit.cfg
medCockpit.mu
medCockpit_txr.dds

They are normally placed directly under the parent GameData folder?

No, htey should be  in :  GameData/KAX/Parts/
I looked into it, and I think I know what was going on.   The ammo used by the vulcan was hitting something that made it accelerate to infinate speed, thus....crash.

4 hours ago, Phineas Freak said:

There is an updated version of KerbPaint from @linuxgurugamer but it seems that BDA is updated for KSP 1.2 yet.

 

12 minutes ago, Draconiator said:

I looked into it, and I think I know what was going on.   The ammo used by the vulcan was hitting something that made it accelerate to infinate speed, thus....crash.

I'm not so sure that 20mm vulcan ammo was the cause of your crash in and of itself ... perhaps check to be sure all of your mods have been updated to their latest versions and remove the ones that have not been updated to work with KSP v1.2.2

You can download BDArmory Continued v0.11.1.6 which is for KSP 1.2.2 from the links found in the OP of the following thread:
